macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks End Week Higher Despite Tech Sell-Off; Dow Hits Record 50,115
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 1.68% to a record 50,115.67, S&P 500 gained 1.42% to 6,932.30, and Nasdaq 100 up 1.68% to 25,075.77 amid tech volatility and rotation to old economy sectors. Weak US labor data boosted Fed rate cut expectations.

items.title: Amazon Earnings Miss on Profits but Signals $200B AI Capex Boosting Nvidia, AMD
items.summary: Amazon reported Q4 earnings miss despite revenue beat, with shares falling on guidance for up to $200 billion 2026 capex driven by AWS AI growth. This lifted AI stocks like Nvidia, AMD, and Broadcom.

items.title: Bitcoin Slides Below $70K to 15-Month Low, Dragging Crypto Stocks
items.summary: Bitcoin fell below $70,000, down 44% from October peak, hitting a 15-month low and pressuring crypto-related stocks like MicroStrategy, though some rebound occurred.

items.title: Weak US Labor Data and Strong ISM PMIs Fuel Rate Cut Hopes
items.summary: US labor data disappointed, intensifying Fed rate cut expectations, while ISM Manufacturing PMI beat expectations strongly and Services PMI met forecasts. Preliminary UoM Inflation Expectations dropped to 3.5%.

items.title: Market Rotation from Tech to Old Economy Sectors Amid Volatility
items.summary: Global markets saw heightened volatility with capital shifting from mega-cap tech to Oil & Gas, Industrials, Materials, and Regional Banks due to better valuations and industrial cycles.

items.title: Novo Nordisk, Eli Lilly Rise on FDA Warning Against Copycat Weight Loss Drugs
items.summary: Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly shares climbed after FDA warning on illegal copycat weight loss drugs, supporting leading names in the sector.

items.title: Airline Stocks Gain as Oil Falls on US-Iran Talks Hopes
items.summary: Alaska Air, Delta, and United Airlines stocks rose with falling oil prices amid US-Iran talks raising supply relief expectations.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Recovers with 3.5% Gain to $71,314 Amid Volatile Week
items.summary: Bitcoin rose 3.5% in the past 24 hours to $71,314 after a 9% weekly drop, with Ethereum up 4.2% to $2,127. Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong calls the volatility normal and remains long-term bullish.

items.title: Whale Withdraws $106.7M in Bitcoin from Binance Signaling Bullish Sentiment
items.summary: A whale moved 1,546 BTC worth $106.7 million from Binance to cold storage, indicating confidence in price recovery. Analysts eye potential breakout above $83K triggering $5.7B short liquidations.

items.title: Bitcoin Mining Difficulty Sees Largest Negative Adjustment Since 2021
items.summary: Bitcoin's mining difficulty dropped sharply on February 8, easing mining costs and potentially drawing miners back if prices stabilize above $60K. This follows a dip to $60K and recovery to $68K-$70K range.

items.title: Crypto Collateralized Lending Hits Record $73.6 Billion Amid Bitcoin Dip
items.summary: Crypto-backed loans reached $73.6 billion per Galaxy Research, with DeFi loans at $41 billion. Platforms like Coinbase and Binance offer loans against Bitcoin collateral up to $5 million.

items.title: Upcoming MegaETH Launch and APT/AVAX Token Unlocks This Week
items.summary: The crypto market week of Feb 9–13 features MegaETH launch, APT and AVAX unlocks, alongside CPI/NFP data influencing rates. Rates are seen as the key driver.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Italy Enacts Law 132/2025 Granting AI National Status and Regulating Cleaning Sector
items.summary: Italy becomes one of the first European countries to transpose the EU AI Act via Law no. 132/2025, mandating transparency, security, and responsibility for AI systems including autonomous cleaning robots and predictive maintenance software. Manufacturers must map products, update documentation, and comply with risk classifications to remain competitive.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Next Year Best-Case Scenario for New Xbox Console, Microsoft Unsure on Price
items.summary: A report indicates that 2027 is the earliest possible launch for a new Xbox console, described as a 'best-case scenario,' with Microsoft still undecided on pricing. This comes amid other Xbox news like server shutdowns for three games in February and March 2026 and a new controller revision planned for 2026.

items.title: France Awards Knighthoods to 28 Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 Developers
items.summary: France has granted knighthoods in the Order of Arts and Letters to 28 developers from Sandfall Interactive for their work on Clair Obscur: Expedition 33, stating that 'video games have reached a new level of recognition.'

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: AutoFlight Flies Largest eVTOL Aircraft at 5-Metric-Ton Class
items.summary: China’s AutoFlight conducted a public demonstration flight of its uncrewed Matrix eVTOL, the first in the 5-metric-ton takeoff weight class, featuring full transition between vertical and horizontal flight.

items.title: Semiconductor Boom Expected to Persist as New Normal Beyond AI Demand
items.summary: Analysts predict Korea’s chip industry, led by Samsung and SK hynix, will sustain its supercycle longer than past surges due to massive infrastructure spending and demand for high-capacity memory like LPDDR5X and ICMS.

items.title: Big Tech's $600 Billion Capex Plans Trigger Stock Selloff in Amazon and Alphabet
items.summary: Big Tech firms plan $600 billion in spending for 2026, leading to sharp declines in Amazon (7%) and Alphabet (up to 8%) shares amid investor concerns over profitability, while Nvidia and Tesla rise.
